page.title: 01Landscape Creca/Kirtlebridge
page.content: This area is mainly grassland. Conifer plantation to the N.W. and a peat moss in the centre. There are sporadic woods of deciduous trees. Oak, Ash and Sycamore are the main trees with hedges of Hawthorn and Beech. Farming is the main industry. Dairy and stock farms. There is a sandstone quarry at Corsehill. Some small industry in Creca village and there is a large Broiler Unit in Kirtlebridge village. The Glasgow-London railway runs through Kirtlebridge but the station is disused. The area is crossed by minor roads B722 and a small section of the A74. The River Kirtle runs through Kirtlebridge. The climate is temperate with a high rainfall. 1985 had the highest rainfall for over 100 years.
